text: The Bury Bible is a giant illustrated Bible written at Bury Saint Edmunds between 1121 and 1148, and illuminated by an artist known as Master Hugo . R. M. Thomson, ‘The date of the Bury Bible reexamined’, Viator, 6 (1975), 51–8. It has been since 1575 in the Parker Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge, with the shelf-mark Cambridge CCCC M 2. C. M. Kauffmann, "The Bury bible (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College , MS. 2" Journal of the Warburg and Courtauld Institutes, no/ 29, 1966, p. 60-81 Bury Bible - F1v - Frater Ambrosius It is an important example of Romanesque illumination from Norman England M Kauffmann: Romanesque Manuscripts 1066-1190. Survey of Manuscripts Illuminated in the British Isles . London, Boston 1975, pp. 86ff. ==Description== Only the first part of the original two-volume work has been preserved. Twelve pictures were painted on parchment on separate pages and then incorporated into the work; six remain. . 42 or the origina 44 painted initials have been preserved.Rodney M. Thomson, The Bury Bible [Facsimile] Boydell Press, 2002, 102 p.
